citations.narrative:
The fencing for two of the camel enclosures is in need of repair. The fencing of the enclosure by the large barn has an
approximately 12 foot section adjacent to the gate and extending toward a smaller barn structure that consists of rusting
loose metal fencing wire with a string of barbed wire on top that the camels have pushed down by leaning on it. The
fencing of the enclosure immediately behind the house has a gate that is only about 4 ft high and a loose short section of
rusted wire fencing adjacent to it. The facility has purchased a new gate for this area but has not had it put in place.
Fencing in need of repair may lead to injury of the camels, escape of the camels in the enclosure or entry of other animals
into the enclosure. Outdoor housing facilities including all fencing and gates shall be structurally sound and shall be
maintained in good repair. Correct by 12/8/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The fencing for two of the camel enclosures is in need of repair. The fencing of the enclosure by the large barn has an 
approximately 12 foot section adjacent to the gate and extending toward a smaller barn structure that consists of rusting 
loose metal fencing wire with a string of barbed wire on top that the camels have pushed down by leaning on it. The 
fencing of the enclosure immediately behind the house has a gate that is only about 4 ft high and a loose short section of 
rusted wire fencing adjacent to it. The facility has purchased a new gate for this area but has not had it put in place. 
Fencing in need of repair may lead to injury of the camels, escape of the camels in the enclosure or entry of other animals 
into the enclosure. Outdoor housing facilities including all fencing and gates shall be structurally sound and shall be 
maintained in good repair. Correct by 12/8/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
